1.text: Use the different vibrato techniques to create different moods.

2.text: Set your metronome to a slow beat and work on your finger movement.

3.text: Make a knocking motion with your hand to perform wrist vibrato.
3.vid: /d/d8/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4

4.text: Expand your knocking movement to create arm vibrato.
4.vid: /c/c9/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Exercise your fingers to increase your finger speed.
6.vid: /4/47/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4

7.text: Try finger vibrato once you've built up your speed.
7.vid: /1/17/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Start with a slower arm vibrato to add in the bow.
8.vid: /c/c9/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4

9.text: Try vibrato with all 4 fingers on all 4 strings.

10.text: Practice vibrato with single notes to develop muscle memory.
10.vid: /5/50/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4

11.text: Move on to practicing vibrato with slow scales.
11.vid: /b/bd/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4

12.text: Incorporate vibrato into a long, slow song to continue your practice.
12.vid: /d/d6/Do Vibrato on a Violin Step 12 Version 2.360p.mp4

13.text: Start by adding vibrato to songs you already know.

14.text: Try arm vibrato for slow or sad songs.

15.text: Use wrist or finger vibrato for fast and lively songs.

16.text: Combine vibrato techniques to add flair and emotion.
